greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = f_n(0), where f_n is the n-th of all functions that are representable as x^x^...^x with m>=1 x's and parentheses inserted in all possible ways, with conventions that 0^0=1^0=1^1=1, 0^1=0.
comment: The ordering of the functions f_n is defined in A215703: f_1, f_2, ... = x, x^x, x^(x^2), x^(x^x), x^(x^3), x^(x^x*x), x^(x^(x^2)), x^(x^(x^x)), x^(x^4), x^(x^x*x^2), ... .
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20299
Wikipedia, Zero to the power of zero
maple: T:= proc(n) T(n):=`if`(n=1, [x], map(h-> x^h, g(n-1$2))) end:
a:= proc() local i, l; i, l:= 0, []; proc(n) while n>nops(l)
do i:= i+1; l:= [l[], subs(x=0, T(i))[]] od; l[n] end
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 05 2019
